content:
CodeDomDesignerLoader Class

Definition

Provides the base class for implementing a CodeDOM-based designer loader.

In this Article

[System.Security.SecurityCritical]
public abstract class CodeDomDesignerLoader : System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.BasicDesignerLoader, System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationService, System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.INameCreationService
Inheritance
Object
DesignerLoader
System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.BasicDesignerLoader
CodeDomDesignerLoader

Remarks

CodeDomDesignerLoader is an abstract class that provides a full designer loader based on the Code Document Object Model (CodeDOM). You provide the CodeDOM parser and generator, and a type resolution service.

Constructors

CodeDomDesignerLoader()

Initializes a new instance of the CodeDomDesignerLoader class.

protected CodeDomDesignerLoader ();

Properties

CodeDomProvider

Gets the CodeDomProvider this designer loader will use.

protected abstract System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider CodeDomProvider { get; }
Value
CodeDomProvider

The CodeDomProvider this designer loader will use

Remarks

The designer loader does not parse or generate code from the returned CodeDomProvider, but it does use the provider to obtain an ICodeGenerator that it can use to validate identifiers in the name-creation service. The designer loader will also check the CodeDomProvider to see if it implements the ICodeDomDesignerReload interface. For more information on parsing or generating code, see the Parse and Write methods.

TypeResolutionService

Gets the type resolution service to be used with this designer loader.

protected abstract System.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeResolutionService TypeResolutionService { get; }
Value
ITypeResolutionService

An ITypeResolutionService that the CodeDOM serializers will use when resolving types.

Remarks

The CodeDomDesignerLoader automatically adds this ITypeResolutionService to the service container when the Initialize method is invoked. While the type resolution service is optional in many scenarios, it is required for code interpretation because source code contains type names, but no assembly references.

Methods

Dispose()

Releases the resources used by the CodeDomDesignerLoader class.

public override void Dispose ();

Remarks

The Dispose method removes services added by the Initialize method.

Call Dispose when you are finished using the CodeDomDesignerLoader. The Dispose method leaves the CodeDomDesignerLoader in an unusable state. After calling Dispose, you must release all references to the CodeDomDesignerLoader so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the CodeDomDesignerLoader was occupying. For more information, see Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources and Implementing a Dispose Method.

Note

Always call Dispose before you release your last reference to the CodeDomDesignerLoader. Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the CodeDomDesignerLoader object's Finalize method.

Initialize()

Initializes services.

protected override void Initialize ();
Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The IDesignerLoaderHost has not been initialized, or the designer loader did not supply a type resolution service, which is required for CodeDom serialization.

Remarks

The following table describes the replaceable services that the CodeDomDesignerLoader adds to the service container.

Term Definition
INameCreationService Provides semantics for creating names of objects. The service uses the CodeDOM providerâ€™s ICodeGenerator interface to create names that are valid identifiers for the language. In addition, the name creation service supports empty names. Empty names should be interpreted as temporary local variables during serialization.
IDesignerSerializationService Allows other objects to serialize a group of components into a binary object. This service is most often used by features such as copy and paste or undo and redo. The CodeDomDesignerLoader class provides a designer serialization service that is based on creating CodeDOM trees for objects.
ComponentSerializationService This service replaces IDesignerSerializationService as a means to serialize components to a binary object.

For details on replaceable and non-replaceable services, see BasicDesignerLoader.

IsReloadNeeded()

Returns a value indicating whether a reload is required.

protected override bool IsReloadNeeded ();
Returns
Boolean

true if the stem.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomDesignerLoader.CodeDomProvider* decides a reload is required; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

The language did not provide a code parser for this file; this file type may not support a designer.

InvalidOperationException

The class can be designed, but it is not the first class in the file, or the designer could not be shown for this file because none of the classes within it can be designed.

Remarks

The IsReloadNeeded method checks for the presence of the ICodeDomDesignerReload interface on the CodeDomProvider. The provider will reparse the CodeDOM tree and pass the resulting parse tree to the ShouldReloadDesigner method. If this method returns false, the designer will not be reloaded.

OnBeginLoad()

Notifies the designer loader that loading is about to begin.

protected override void OnBeginLoad ();

Remarks

For more information on the OnBeginLoad method, see OnBeginLoad.

OnBeginUnload()

Notifies the designer loader that unloading is about to begin.

protected override void OnBeginUnload ();

Remarks

For more information on the OnBeginUnload method, see OnBeginUnload.

OnComponentRename(Object,String,String)

Raises the ComponentRename event.

protected virtual void OnComponentRename (object component, string oldName, string newName);
component
Object

The component to rename.

oldName
String

The original name of the component.

newName
String

The new name of the component.

OnEndLoad(Boolean,ICollection)

Notifies the designer loader that loading is complete.

protected override void OnEndLoad (bool successful, System.Collections.ICollection errors);
successful
Boolean

true to indicate that the load completed successfully; otherwise, false.

errors
ICollection

An ICollection of objects (usually exceptions) that were reported as errors.

Remarks

For more information on the OnEndLoad method, see OnEndLoad.

Parse()

Parses the text or other persistent storage and returns a CodeCompileUnit.

protected abstract System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit Parse ();
Returns
CodeCompileUnit

A CodeCompileUnit resulting from a parse operation.

Remarks

The Parse method is called when the CodeDomDesignerLoader needs to parse the source code. The source code location and format must be specified by deriving classes.

PerformFlush(IDesignerSerializationManager)

Requests serialization of the root component of the designer.

protected override void PerformFlush (System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager manager);
manager
IDesignerSerializationManager

The IDesignerSerializationManager from which to request the serializer.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

The language did not provide a code parser for this file; this file type may not support a designer.

InvalidOperationException

The class can be designed, but it is not the first class in the file, or the designer could not be shown for this file because none of the classes within it can be designed.

Remarks

The PerformFlush method obtains the root CodeDomSerializer for the root component of the designer and invokes the serializer to serialize the component. If the result of this operation is a CodeTypeDeclaration, then PerformFlush integrates the CodeTypeDeclaration with the existing CodeDOM tree. The result is the original CodeDOM tree with matching members and statements replaced. Finally, PerformFlush calls the abstract Write method to save this CodeDOM tree.

If the serialization of the root designer component does not result in a CodeTypeDeclaration, then PerformFlush does nothing further.

Important

It is the responsibility of the caller to ensure that a CodeDOM originates from a trusted source. Accepting a CodeDOM object from an untrusted party could allow that party to run malicious code. When flushing a CodeDOM into a file, the framework will run code represented by the CodeDOM object and the serialized content of the object as provided.

PerformLoad(IDesignerSerializationManager)

Parses code from a CodeDOM provider.

protected override void PerformLoad (System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager manager);
manager
IDesignerSerializationManager

The IDesignerSerializationManager from which to request the serializer.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

The language did not provide a code parser for this file; this file type may not support a designer.

InvalidOperationException

The class can be designed, but it is not the first class in the file, or the designer could not be shown for this file because none of the classes within it can be designed.

Remarks

The PerformLoad method obtains an ICodeParser from the CodeDOM provider and parses the code. PerformLoad locates the first class in the file, obtains a root CodeDomSerializer for the data type, and then invokes the serializer to deserialize the data type. PerformLoad assumes that this process will create all necessary components in the IContainer of the LoaderHost property. Finally, PerformLoad calls the SetBaseComponentClassName method with the fully qualified name of the type it passed to the CodeDOM serializer.

Important

It is the responsibility of the caller to ensure that a CodeDOM originates from a trusted source. Accepting a CodeDOM object from an untrusted party could allow that party to run malicious code. When loading a CodeDOM into the design surface, the framework will run code represented by the CodeDOM object and the serialized content of the object as provided.

Write(CodeCompileUnit)

Writes compile-unit changes to persistent storage.

protected abstract void Write (System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit unit);
unit
CodeCompileUnit

The CodeCompileUnit to be persisted.

Remarks

The Write method saves a CodeCompileUnit to persistent storage. The deriving class is responsible for invoking the ICodeGenerator on the appropriate text writer to save the code. The CodeDomDesignerLoader ensures that the CodeDOM objects that are passed to Write are the same instances of objects that were retrieved from Parse, except in cases where the serialization process had to make changes to the code. This allows an optimized designer loader to store additional data in the UserData property of code elements. This data will be available during the Write method for any elements that were not replaced by the serialization process.

Explicit Interface Implementations

IDesignerSerializationService.Deserialize(Object)

Deserializes the specified serialization data object and returns a collection of objects represented by that data.

System.Collections.ICollection IDesignerSerializationService.Deserialize (object serializationData);
serializationData
Object

An object consisting of serialized data.

Returns
ICollection

A collection of objects represented by serializationData.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

serializationData is not a SerializationStore.

IDesignerSerializationService.Serialize(ICollection)

Serializes the specified collection of objects and stores them in a serialization data object.

object IDesignerSerializationService.Serialize (System.Collections.ICollection objects);
objects
ICollection

A collection of objects to serialize.

Returns
Object

An object that contains the serialized state of the specified collection of objects.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The ComponentSerializationService was not found.

INameCreationService.CreateName(IContainer,Type)

Creates a new name that is unique to all components in the specified container.

string INameCreationService.CreateName (System.ComponentModel.IContainer container, Type dataType);
container
IContainer

The container where the new object is added.

dataType
Type

The data type of the object that receives the name.

Returns
String

A unique name for the data type.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

dataType is null.

INameCreationService.IsValidName(String)

Gets a value indicating whether the specified name is valid.

bool INameCreationService.IsValidName (string name);
name
String

The name to validate.

Returns
Boolean

true if the name is valid; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

name is null.

INameCreationService.ValidateName(String)

Gets a value indicating whether the specified name is valid.

void INameCreationService.ValidateName (string name);
name
String

The name to validate.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

name is null.

ArgumentException

name is not a valid identifier, or there is already a component with the same name.
